info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 02 at 3:45PM EDT until June 02 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... East central Henderson County in western North Carolina... Western Polk County in western North Carolina... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 345 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northwest of Columbus, or 5 miles north of Saluda, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Columbus, Saluda, Dana, Mill Spring, Edneyville, Lake Adger, East Flat Rock and Chimney Rock State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
